description: Rotavirus is one of nine genera amongst the family Reoviridae. It has a characteristic wheel-like appearance under electron microscopy and is one of the most common causes of diarrhoea among children worldwide. There are six viral proteins (VPs) that form the virus particle (virion). These structural proteins are called VP1, VP2, VP3, VP4, VP6 and VP7.
name: Rotavirus Antibodies and Antigens
